intro: Arrabidaea platyphylla var. induta, commonly known as the purple-leafed coral tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, known for its nitrogen-fixing capabilities. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular ornamental in warm climates. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a valuable addition to gardens and landscapes.
